messages.message:
Hi @Varun Jain @avi, we are looking to determine how/when AI Hub Build can be used for Sonic.  Is there any timeline for when Build will be as accurate as Converse?
CC @Varun K V @debstuti.das @jennifer

Hi @Alex Sgueglia - can you share more about the use case at Sonic, and the kind of queries / fields you’re testing on Build / Converse? 

cc: @Eric Han

The sonic use case is for invoice extraction.  @Varun K V tested with Converse with the following results:
• Supplier, Store Name, and Address fields were extracted perfectly for 10 random samples
    ◦ This is a huge improvement from DL based approach as it requires template training 
• Total Bill Amount, Invoice Line Items, Invoice/Work Order Number, PO Number are being extracted correctly for 3 random samples
Is it possible to share the samples, schema details and the prompts used so far? What was the experience with using Build with same fields?
Converse was able to extract these fields correctly but Build was not able to extract any answer/fields for the same sample
@Varun K V please add more details on the samples/prompts when you can
Here is an example of an invoice tried in build mode with similar query for which no value was returned
@Dan H How do this compare to what you've tried for Essential Utilities?
We are using the ai hub api into refiner using build.  I’d be careful about using that method for a solution in prod today
cc @Rafal @vineeth do you know why the response here is different? Is it from parsing errors for the provenance-extractor?
The build app uses converse pipeline only for long docs. Hence the inconsistency
